chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: poset
s: Pred T
y: {x : T | x \In s}
x: {x : T | x \In s}

Goal:
sub_leq x y -> sub_leq y x -> x = y

Premises:
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
sub_leq = fun p1 p2 : {x : T | x \In s} => sval p1 <== sval p2 : {x : T | x \In s} -> {x : T | x \In s} -> Prop
Notation poset := Poset.type
sub_refl : forall x : {x : T | x \In s}, sub_leq x x
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y0 : ?T, ?x = ?f y0 /\ y0 \In ?s where ?T : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- Type] ?T' : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- Type] ?f : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- ?T'] ?s : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- seq ?T]
Tagged : forall T_ : ?I -> Type, T_ ?i -> {x : ?I & T_ x} where ?I : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- Type] ?i : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- ?I]
vrefl_rect : forall x0 : ?T, ?P x0 -> x0 = x0 where ?T : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- Type] ?P : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- pred ?T]
svalP : forall u : {x : ?T | ?P x}, ?P (sval u) where ?T : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- Type] ?P : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- ?T -> Prop]
ssrfun.svalP : forall u : {x : ?T | ?P x}, ?P (sval u) where ?T : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- Type] ?P : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- ?T -> Prop]
Fin.to_nat_of_nat : forall h : (?p < ?n)%coq_nat, Fin.to_nat (Fin.of_nat_lt h) = exist (lt^~ ?n) ?p h where ?p : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- nat] ?n : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- nat]
PosetMixin : forall (T : Type) (mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop), (forall x : T, mx_leq x x) -> (forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y) -> (forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z) -> Poset.mixin_of T
poset_asym : forall (T : poset) (x y : T), x <== y -> y <== x -> x = y
SubType : forall (sub_sort : Type) (val : sub_sort -> ?T) (Sub : forall x0 : ?T, ?P x0 -> sub_sort), (forall K : sub_sort -> Type, (forall (x0 : ?T) (Px : ?P x0), K (Sub x0 Px)) -> forall u : sub_sort, K u) -> (forall (x0 : ?T) (Px : ?P x0), val (Sub x0 Px) = x0) -> subType ?P where ?T : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- Type] ?P : [T : poset s : Pred T x : {x : T | x \In s} y : {x : T | x \In s} |- pred ?T]
Record mixin_of (T : Type) : Type := Mixin { mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop; _ : forall x : T, mx_leq x x; _ : forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y; _ : forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z } Arguments Poset.mixin_of _%type_scope Arguments Poset.Mixin [T]%type_scope [mx_leq]%function_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
Pred_of_Simpl_morph : forall (T : Type) (x y : Simpl_Pred T), EqSimplPred x y -> x <~> y
predC_morph : forall (T : Type) (x y : Pred_Class), x <~> y -> PredC x <~> PredC y
poset_trans : forall (T : poset) (y x z : T), x <== y -> y <== z -> x <== z
Mem_morhp : forall (T : Type) (pT : PredType T) (x y : pT), x <~> y -> x =p y
Mem_Seq1 : forall (T : Type) (x y : T), x \In [:: y] < -> x = y
InE : forall T : Type, (forall x y : T, x \In [:: y] <-> x = y) * (forall (y : T) (s : seq T) (x : T), x \In y :: s <-> x = y \/ x \In s) * (forall (T0 : Type) (x : T0) (p : Simpl_Pred T0), (x \In p) = p x)
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.gt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
In_cons : forall (T : Type) (y : T) (s : seq T) (x : T), x \In y :: s < -> x = y \/ x \In s
ZArith_dec.Z_noteq_dec : forall x y : BinNums.Z, {x <> y} + {x = y}
InMem_morph : forall (T : Type) (x y : T), x = y -> forall x0 y0 : Mem_Pred T, EqMem x0 y0 -> InMem x x0 < -> InMem y y0
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
predI_morph : forall (T : Type) (x y : Pred_Class), x <~> y -> forall x0 y0 : Pred_Class, x0 <~> y0 -> PredI x x0 <~> PredI y y0
predU_morph : forall (T : Type) (x y : Pred_Class), x <~> y -> forall x0 y0 : Pred_Class, x0 <~> y0 -> EqSimplPred (PredU x x0) (PredU y y0)
EqdepFacts.internal_eq_rew_r_dep : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (P : forall y0 : A, y0 = y -> Type), P y (erefl y) -> forall H : x = y, P x H
Zbool.Z_noteq_bool : forall x y : BinNums.Z, {b : bool | if b then x <> y else x = y}
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
EqdepFacts.eq_dep_eq_sig : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Prop) (p q : U) (x : P p) (y : P q), EqdepFacts.eq_dep U P p x q y -> exist P p x = exist P q y
EqdepFacts.eq_sig_eq_dep : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Prop) (p q : U) (x : P p) (y : P q), exist P p x = exist P q y -> EqdepFacts.eq_dep U P p x q y
ZArith_dec.Z_le_gt_dec : forall x y : BinNums.Z, {BinInt.Z.le x y} + {BinInt.Z.gt x y}
EqdepFacts.eq_sig_iff_eq_dep : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Prop) (p q : U) (x : P p) (y : P q), exist P p x = exist P q y < -> EqdepFacts.eq_dep U P p x q y
all_sig_cond_dep : forall (I : Type) (T : I -> Type) (C : pred I) (P : forall x : I, T x -> Prop), (forall x : I, T x) -> (forall x : I, C x -> {y : T x | P x y}) -> {f : forall x : I, T x | forall x : I, C x -> P x (f x)}
all_sig_cond : forall (I T : Type) (C : pred I) (P : I -> T -> Prop), T -> (forall x : I, C x -> {y : T | P x y}) -> {f : I -> T | forall x : I, C x -> P x (f x)}
Image_mem : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (P : Pred A) (x : A), x \In P -> f x \In [Image f i | i <- P]
all_sig : forall (I : Type) (T : I -> Type) (P : forall x : I, T x -> Prop), (forall x : I, {y : T x | P x y}) -> {f : forall x : I, T x | forall x : I, P x (f x)}
Mem_map : forall (T T' : Type) (f : T -> T') (x : T) (s : seq T), x \In s -> f x \In [seq f i | i <- s]
all_tag_cond_dep : forall (I : Type) (T : I -> Type) (C : pred I) (U : forall x : I, T x -> Type), (forall x : I, T x) -> (forall x : I, C x -> {y : T x & U x y}) -> {f : forall x : I, T x & forall x : I, C x -> U x (f x)}
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
all_tag : forall (I : Type) (T : I -> Type) (U : forall x : I, T x -> Type), (forall x : I, {y : T x & U x y}) -> {f : forall x : I, T x & forall x : I, U x (f x)}

``` 
intros.
unfold sub_leq.
intros.
apply (poset_asym _ _ y).
- destruct H, H0.
  + apply (sub_refl _ s y).
  + apply False_ind, (poset_trans _ _ y x y); assumption.
- destruct H, H0.
  + apply False_ind, (poset_trans _ _ x y x); assumption.
  + apply (sub_refl _ s x).
```

original: intros. unfold sub_leq. intros. apply (poset_asym _ _ y). - destruct H, H0. + apply (sub_refl _ s y). + apply False_ind, (poset_trans _ _ y x y); auto. - destruct H, H0. + apply False_ind, (poset_trans _ _ x y x); auto. + apply (sub_refl _ s x).
